meanings.definition: To unite or join together before something else
meanings.sent1: The team preunites before every game to discuss strategy.
meanings.sent2: She always preunites the ingredients before starting to bake a cake.
meanings.sent3: The ants preunite to carry a large piece of food back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the rainbow preunite to create a beautiful spectrum.
meanings.sent5: The students preunite their ideas to form a cohesive presentation.

meanings.definition: The act of uniting or joining together before something else
meanings.sent1: The preunites of the two groups led to a successful collaboration.
meanings.sent2: His preunites with other artists helped him grow as a musician.
meanings.sent3: The preunites of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent4: The preunites of the dancers on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The preunites of the ingredients in the recipe are crucial for a delicious dish.
